page.title: 03HEATHLAND.
page.content: These areas consist of High Curley, Colony Bog and Strawberry Bottom & are mainly heathland & bogs.The heathland wildlife(where one can investigate it) consists mainly of ash,birch,pine,oak and willow trees.There are many diff- erent grasses that mingle with ferns and assortment of heathers.Gorse,blac- kberry,clover and daisies also grow in abundance.Evidence of foxes & badgers, rabbits & ants is also seen.The soil is very sandy under a fine layer of gravel.This means that it drains well but is prone to fire.The plants reest- ablish themselves fairly easily after each fire,so it does not look barren for long.In the bog areas the same trees are found as well as different ferns and heathers.The grasses are basically the same but some species have longer stems with a more robust texture.
